@graph.name: George William Beccaloni
@graph.jobTitle: Director of the Wallace Correspondence Project
@graph.description: I am an entomologist, evolutionary biologist, taxonomist, museum curator and science historian, who worked at London’s Natural History Museum as a research entomologist and curator (specialising in cockroaches and butterflies) for 20 years. I have studied the life and work of Alfred Russel Wallace (the co-discover of evolution by natural selection) for 18 years and am the founder and Director of the Wallace Correspondence Project.
